net.letscode.game.api.controller

Interface Controller

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChatController
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlayerChatController

    public interface Controller
    Defines an abstract controller; that is, a set of requirements needed to fulfill some role for an Entity. These requirements are generally zone specific; for example, a ChatZone might require a ChatController to give an entity chat functionality. These should remain pluggable; that is, it should be possible to change the implementation of a controller on demand.

    Controllers have a set lifecycle, particularly in that they should be expected to be able to activate, deactivate, and potentially reactivate at any time. Additionally, the entity upon which they should operate may change when reactivated, so this should not be assumed.

    Author:
    timothyb89

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onActivated(Entity e)
      Called when this Controller has been activated for the given entity.
      void onDeactivated(Entity e)
      Called when this Controller has been deactivated for the given entity.

    • Method Detail

      • onActivated

        void onActivated(Entity e)
        Called when this Controller has been activated for the given entity. This can be used to register any necessary listeners or to otherwise prepare for use.
        Parameters:
        e - the entity that has started using this controller

      • onDeactivated

        void onDeactivated(Entity e)
        Called when this Controller has been deactivated for the given entity. This can be used to deregister any listeners or to otherwise clean up.
        Parameters:
        e - the entity that has stopped using this controller
